PositionHistory.Title: Application Developer Consultant
PositionHistory.Description:
IFS is a part of Boston based State Street Corporation specializing in middle office and back office processing for financial service clients mainly for Hedge Funds of all sizes.
Data Services for my.statestreet.com my.statestreet.com is a Flex based front end that presents various data points from a Netezza data warehouse and reporting capabilities. This is a high visibility project supporting a large number of hedge funds. As a member of back office team I am responsible for developing REST based web services to pull data from Netezza Data warehouse and present it to my.statestreet.com. All the Request Responses are handled as XML The xml requests/ responses are mapped to java objects using Jaxb. The application is deployed to a load balanced set of Tomcat servers running on Solaris. The Data Web Services layer is implemented using Spring 3.1.x. My job is to interact with various teams including Business Analysts, ETL developers, UI developers, offshore developers and develop / oversee Data Services layer. Customized SQL queries to run on Netezza DB. Familiar with development of Jasper reports as part of this project. We use agile methodology. Test driven development methodology is used.
Data Export Extracts This is a web and batch processing application that provides on demand or nightly data feeds to various clients pulling data from a Sybase database called General Ledger System. This is a Struts, Spring based java application connecting to Sybase. Worked on various enhancements and bug fixes for this platform.
Reporting web services: Developed a set of web services to expose data pulled from set of external services within IFS such as RDM(pulls reference quote data from Bloomberg) and Caliber. The external services are either web sevices or RMI based applications. This application uses Spring jdbc and SOAP / REST web services.

PositionHistory.Title: Senior Systems Analyst
PositionHistory.Description: OSG has an onsite, offshore model where the functional analysis and technical design of the projects is done onsite in NY and development teams were based in NY and other worldwide locations. During the development phase the Team in NY monitored the technical progress of various modules. Did hands on development throughout the development life cycle. During my 4 years stay there I have worked on 3 important projects listed below. These projects were implemented using a mix of Core Java, J2EE,Spring framework, Hibernate/JDBC with Eclipse as the IDE of choice.

Financial Reporting websites for Pools commercially manages 3 Pools of 100+ large oil tankers. Each pool needs to do its Quarter end Earnings reporting and periodic Cash distribution through using Java/J2ee web platform we developed. I was the lead for all 3 commercial websites. The key technologies used were Java, Spring Framework, YUI and Oracle database. The system was developed and debugged using Eclipse 3.4 using Tomcat. Team consisted of 4+1 Developers/Lead in India and 2 people in NY with additional support from a DBA.

Charter Analysis Module for Vessels Each of OSG 100+ OSG vessels had to do daily reporting of key parameters and this data has to be transmitted periodically to the Office servers using satellite. The data was collected and analyzed in onshore offices. This module was critical as it defined current and future oil transport business. The system was built using Java, Spring Framework, Hibernate and was deployed n Sun One Application Server.

{{DOCUMENT_DATESTAMP}} 2014-3-9 {{END_DOCUMENT_DATESTAMP}}
Ramesh Pachanady 31 Westgate Dr, Edison NJ Home : 908 279 7005 Cell : 845 505 5502 Email:pachanady@gmail.com
Objective: Seeking a challenging position as Sr. Java Developer Architect / Sr. Tech Lead with a growth-oriented organization where my skills, experience will be utilized to their full potential and make a positive impact . Summary * Over 16 years of experience in functional and technical aspects and Software Development including distributed Java EE applications using industry frameworks. ; * Worked on Oracle Weblogic Application server, Tomcat and other Java app servers / web servers. ; * Good design skills, worked on several Java, Java EE, Spring framework based projects. Team leader and a good team player. ; * Good knowledge of Spring framework Struts,Hibernate ; * Excellent knowledge of end to end development and debugging in Eclipse IDE. ; * Experienced in full software development life cycle including definition, analysis, design, and development and testing of code using Agile methodologies. Experienced in customer problem tracking and resolution. ; * Good inter personnel skills, Good technical writing skills, and Strong customer orientation. ; * Good experience in MVC design patterns. ; * 4+ years of experience in working on projects for IBM Global Services NY. ; * Extensive experience in developing REST based web services. Experienced in SOAP, JAX-RPC,JAX-WS. ; * Database development skills in Oracle , DB2. PL/SQL development in Oracle. ; * Work experience with medium to large size teams of up to 40 people ; * Core Java skills including multi threading in Java 6, JDBC, Collections ; * Designing SQLs for Netezza Datawarehouse platform. ; * Knowledge of Front end development using JSPs, jQuery, javascript
Technical Skills and Tools:
OS Linux , Solaris , AIX, Windows 7 Languages/Frameworks Java 6 & 7 , Java EE 6, Spring framework 3.1.x App Servers Weblogic 11g, Websphere , Sun One Application Server Databases Oracle 10g,IBM Db2 8.2, DB2 7.1 SCM SVN,CVS Web / RIA JavaScript, YUI, JQuery Build Tools Maven, Ant IDE Eclipse Juno, Netbeans Testing Junit, Mockito
Education: * Master of Science in Computer Science, St Aloysius College , Mangalore, India. Year 1996 ; * Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Mangalore University, Mangalore, India. Year 1994
Professional Experience: International Fund Services (IFS - A State Street Company) New York, NY, February 2011 - Present
AVP - Application Developer Consultant
IFS is a part of Boston based State Street Corporation specializing in middle office and back office processing for financial service clients mainly for Hedge Funds of all sizes.
Data Services for my.statestreet.com my.statestreet.com is a Flex based front end that presents various data points from a Netezza data warehouse and reporting capabilities. This is a high visibility project supporting a large number of hedge funds. As a member of back office team I am responsible for developing REST based web services to pull data from Netezza Data warehouse and present it to my.statestreet.com. All the Request Responses are handled as XML The xml requests/ responses are mapped to java objects using Jaxb. The application is deployed to a load balanced set of Tomcat servers running on Solaris. The Data Web Services layer is implemented using Spring 3.1.x. My job is to interact with various teams including Business Analysts, ETL developers, UI developers, offshore developers and develop / oversee Data Services layer. Customized SQL queries to run on Netezza DB. Familiar with development of Jasper reports as part of this project. We use agile methodology. Test driven development methodology is used.

This is a Struts, Spring based java application connecting to Sybase. Worked on various enhancements and bug fixes for this platform.
Reporting web services: Developed a set of web services to expose data pulled from set of external services within IFS such as RDM(pulls reference quote data from Bloomberg) and Caliber. The external services are either web sevices or RMI based applications. This application uses Spring jdbc and SOAP / REST web services.
Employer: Indotronix International Corporation(IIC) ,Poughkeepsie NY Client: Overseas Shipholding Group(OSG), New York, NY January 2007 - Sept 2007
Employer: Overseas Shipholding Group(OSG), New York, NY October 2007 - February 2011
Senior Systems Analyst
OSG has an onsite, offshore model where the functional analysis and technical design of the projects is done onsite in NY and development teams were based in NY and other worldwide locations. During the development phase the Team in NY monitored the technical progress of various modules. Did hands on development throughout the development life cycle. During my 4 years stay there I have worked on 3 important projects listed below. These projects were implemented using a mix of Core Java, J2EE,Spring framework, Hibernate/JDBC with Eclipse as the IDE of choice.
Financial Reporting websites for Pools(August 2009 - Nov 2010) OSG commercially manages 3 Pools of 100+ large oil tankers. Each pool needs to do its Quarter end Earnings reporting and periodic Cash distribution through using Java/J2ee web platform we developed. I was the lead for all 3 commercial websites. The key technologies used were Java, Spring Framework, YUI and Oracle database. The system was developed and debugged using Eclipse 3.4 using Tomcat. Team consisted of 4+1 Developers/Lead in India and 2 people in NY with additional support from a DBA.
Charter Analysis Module for Vessels(Jan 2008-Nov 2010) Each of OSG 100+ OSG vessels had to do daily reporting of key parameters and this data has to be transmitted periodically to the Office servers using satellite. The data was collected and analyzed in onshore offices. This module was critical as it defined current and future oil transport business. The system was built using Java, Spring Framework, Hibernate and was deployed n Sun One Application Server.
Safety Quality and Environmental module for the Vessels(Jan 2007-Nov 2007) We developed a tomcat, Java based Intranet application for the same. Team consisted of 3 developers and a database developer. I was the lead for this module.
Ship to Office Database development Each new module developed in Office typically has piece that needs to be added to the Replication mechanism. I am the main developer for this development. This improved my Oracle/Sybase skills.
Responsibilities * Design and architect new projects using best practices and tools/frameworks like J2EE, Spring and Oracle databases ,Core Java APIs. Hands on coding during the construction Phase of all the projects. ; * Mentor junior developers about the architecture, monitor the overall project progress and the implementation on Web logic 10.3.1 ; * Development of Replication triggers, procedures to facilitate Ship to Office data transfer using Oracle and Design of Data Transfer using Spring JDBC. ; * Development using Eclipse IDE, debugging on Tomcat/Glassfish, testing using Junit. ; * Hands on development using a mix of Java , Spring, J2EE, Hibernate technologies. ; * Worked on the design and development of new UI using JSP,YUI, Freemarker ; * Writing multi threaded backend Jobs in Java
Employer: Indotronix International Corporation(IIC) ,Poughkeepsie NY Client: Verizon, White Plains NY May 2006 - Dec 2006 * Worked as a senior consultant on J2EE projects using Weblogic 8.1 ,struts, J2EE on sun Solaris . ; * Design modules and work with offshore team and help them implement as per the design. ; * Monitor and trouble shoot applications running on weblogic
Employer: Indotronix International Corporation(IIC) ,Poughkeepsie NY Client: AVON Cosmetics, Rye, NY June 2005 - April 2006 * Worked as a senior software consultant for the migration of ecommerce site to a Websphere Application Server (WAS) 6 based platform built using Spring framework. The site was re architected using J2EE and Spring framework, to run on WAS 6.X. ; * Worked with medium size team that had around 15 developers and team leads.
Responsibilities: * Lead designer for Spring framework based design of the web site. ; * Design and monitor local build and code drops ; * Unit testing on Rational Application developer ; * WebService client development using APACHE axis ; * Worked on asynchronous message processing using Message Driven Beans
Employer: Indotronix International Corporation(IIC) ,Poughkeepsie NY Client: IBM Global Services, Poughkeepsie, NY May 2001 - June 2005 Title: Senior java consultant Project: eNav Senior java consultant for the Sales Engagement Tool project (eNav). The goal of this project is to help the sales team provide the ability to work on customer engagements offline as well as on site and help them to be able to synchronize the data with central repository as needed. Responsibilities: * Lead developer for Eclipse Client and WebServices sub project. ; * Designed Simple web client running on Tomcat that can be deployed on laptop computers. ; * Design of the centralized website (repository) running on WebSphere using J2EE, Struts and Enterprise Java Beans. ; * Worked on simple UML diagrams like Class Diagrams and Interaction diagrams. Tools/Languages used: WebSphere Application Server 6.0, Rational Software Architect 6.0,Tomcat, Eclipse 3.0.2
Project: HelpNow ID Administration 3.1 & 2.0 Title: Senior java consultant Worked as a senior java consultant on the HelpNow ID Administration project version 3.0 & 3.1.This is a user Id administration and automation software for large companies. The target deployment platforms were WebSphere 5.0 on AIX and on Windows. 'Websphere Studio Application Developer 5.0' was used as the development tool. Responsibilities: * Worked on getting a prototype up to help other team members build further on it. Wrote design documents to explain the same. ; * Worked on a designing business objects that will interact with Data Access Layer using JDBC on DB2 8.1 and Websphere Connection pooling. Built the XML schema for the data for rendering by XSLT. ; * Setting up SSL on Websphere for secure communication. ; * Worked with medium size team that had around 15 developers and team leads. ; * Installation and configuration of Websphere Application Server. ; * Developed a multi threaded Business Rule engine using Java Threads and other core java features. This module was designed to serve 100s of concurrent users.
Tools/Languages used: WebSphere application server 5.0, Websphere Studio 5, J2EE 1.3.JDK 1.4,Eclipse Modelling Framework, XSLT, JSP
Project: HelpNow ID Administration 1.0 As a Senior java consultant worked on the ID Administration project. The primary functions of ID Administration included automation of a variety of functions across a set of platforms for multiple users. This eliminated/reduced the need for a large number of System Administrators. The platforms supported in the first release were MVS using RACF, Linux, AIX, Solaris and HP/UX Windows NT and Windows 2000 Server, including Active Directory Services. The ID Administration application was implemented using MQSeries messaging architecture. XML based messaging is used to store requests and get responses from the MQSeries Responsibilities: * Worked with the team to design the interaction between Servlet, MQ Series and Java based business rule processor backend ; * Installation, configuration and testing of the application on WebSphere application server version 3.5
EJIVA March 2001 - May 2001 * Worked on installation and customization of weblogic server 5.1 for EJIVA technology center.

The web-based payroll processing system had multiple tiers. * Development of the EASYPAY application layer using servlets and Java business objects. ; * Session management. Wrote the daemon process to cleanup dead sessions. ; * Communication with ORACLE and AS400n using JDBC, stored procedures.

Employer: Mastech, Pittsburgh PA Client: Renaissance Cruises, FL Oct 1998-Nov 1999 * Worked on building a set of Servlets for tracking web pages and emails. ; * Worked on a Java based reservation system for Renaissance Cruises in Ft Lauderdale, Florida.

ExperienceSummary.ExecutiveBrief: Ramesh Pachanady is a resident of Edison, NJ, US. He has been working in the IT occupational sector for more than 24 years. Currently he is employed as an Application Developer Consultant at International Fund Services. Ramesh has extensive knowledge of Java, Spring Framework, Oracle, Java 2 Enterprise Edition, Jakarta TOMCAT Servlet Engine, IBM WebSphere, WebLogic Enterprise Application Server, JDBC, IBM WebSphere Application Server, ECLiPSe, DB2, Sun Solaris, Struts Web Application Framework, Java Server Pages, Hibernate, YUI, WebSphere MQ, Java Servlets, AIX UNIX, XSLT, Sybase, SOAP, Linux, JUnit, XML Schema, XML, Websphere Studio 5, WebSphere Studio Application Developer, Web Services, UML/OMT, Stored Procedures, Secure Socket Layer, Rational Software Architect 6.0, REST, RDM, RACF, Message-Driven Beans, MVS, LDAP, Java Threads, Java RMI, JDK, IBM Hardware, IBM HTTP Server, IBM AS400 Hardware, HP/UX Windows NT, Enterprise Java Beans, Eclipse Modelling Framework, ETL, Class Diagrams, Apache Axis, Agile Methodology, Active Directory. So far Ramesh has not gained any managerial experience.
